description: Identifies 'clarifications' that actually weaken the original claims. Detects strategic retreats disguised as corrections of misunderstanding.
researcher_question: Where are 'clarifications' actually retreats from stronger positions?

retreats.clarification_claim: string - what author says they're clarifying
retreats.how_it_weakens: string - specific way the position is weakened
retreats.rhetorical_framing: string - how retreat is disguised as clarification

extraction.core_question: Where are 'clarifications' actually retreats from stronger positions?
extraction_steps: IDENTIFY CLARIFICATION CLAIMS: Find where author says they're clarifying
LOCATE ORIGINAL: Find the original position being 'clarified'
COMPARE STRENGTH: Assess whether the clarification weakens the claim
ANALYZE FRAMING: Note how the retreat is disguised
DOCUMENT PATTERN: Identify recurring retreat strategies
extraction.special_instructions: Focus on cases where 'clarification' language masks genuine retreat. The tell is when the 'clarified' position is materially weaker than the original.

id_examples.to: Retreat: 'What I actually meant was...' weakens claim

concretization.naming_guidance: Name by the original claim being weakened
